Ratings.comment: Awful professor
He makes the class harder for no reason and does not grade homeworks for the longest time. Very strict in grading.
No grades because no grader not his fault
Hands down the best professor I have had at this University

The final exam is tomorrow and he has graded a single assignment this entire semester. This is just beyond ridiculous. He is a decent lecturer and educator but not only are his exams way too long for the time provided, and you will have zero clue what your grade is until your final grade goes in which is frankly lazy and rude to students.

I had Drew for 3561 he does an excellent job of explaining things and teaching the information. But he has submitted only a handful of grades. We are taking his final in 3 days and he hasn't graded any of the homework, Midterm 2, and the projects. I get professors have a lot of stuff to do but this is ridiculous.

Drew is a good professor but he has not graded anything for our capstone class the last grade he put in was two months ago and we are taking finals right now. This is really annoying what is the point of turning in a draft if we are not going to get feedback by the time it is due.

I took the ECE 2360 course with him. It was his first semester teaching it, and for that reason it wasn't the greatest of experiences. He used Canvas for attendance surveys, but he wasn't the fastest grader compared to other professors for homework and quizzes. But other than that, he's fantastic and everyone should try to take the class with him.
Drew is really friendly and helpful during office hours. He is organized and gives good lectures. He is one of the best instructors in the department. He explains concepts very clearly.

I highly recommend taking any course taught by Drew. He is an outstanding instructor who dedicates considerable time outside of class to ensure his students' success. I attended his ECE 2060 summer course, which moved at a faster pace. But Drew made the class manageable and inspiring. I have nothing but praise for his approach and commitment.

Drew is caring and amazing professor who cares that his students are learning the material. His lectures are interactive and make it worth attending. The homeworks were long but there were few of them and they prepared me for the midterms and final. He was super helpful in office hours and I would highly recommend taking any class with Drew.

Drew was technically a Graduate TA when I had him but still he best teacher I've ever had. I don't think he teaches the course anymore but I'm sure he would be great at any course. He is caring and extremely knowledgeable. You will not regret taking a course with him.

He taught the 1 credit technical writing portion of the class. He is willing to help in any way that he can. He is very understanding and wants students to succeed. Very nice guy. Seems to enjoy teaching.
Not recommended at all

Your rating could be removed if you use profanity or derogatory terms.
Don't claim that the professor shows bias or favoritism for or against students.
Don't forget to proof read!

I enjoyed Illindala lectures. He does have an accent which could make it difficult to understand but he records all his lectures and teach the course well. The homeworks are somewhat difficult but his grading isn't too harsh. Exams are exactly like the homeworks.
Lectures were pretty boring overall. Homeworks were okay, but were clearly just old problems with random numbers thrown in that didn't end up making any sense.
Avoid taking his subject. He is impossible to understand.
Absolutely cares for his students and if you put in the work you will do well. Curves the grade and is generally willing to work with you for makeups.
His concepts are not clear and he simply answers doubts vaguely. Teaching is monotonous as if he is frustrated with his own life.

home works are so long like 8 parts per question basically. possessor is kind of boring. no cheat sheet for midterms his definition of cheat sheet is a formula sheet. random memorization of schematics. test tend to be long and boring.

His lectures are clear and organized which is nice. Sometimes he can go off on random tangents though, especially if you ask a question. Then we get behind in the notes and he will either just skip it and expect you to learn it or rush through it. The homeworks are long and hard.

I know a lot of people give him crap, but Illindala is actually a good professor in my book. He gave a nice curve for 5041 (80-85% was a B+ for reference). Beware of the final paper though, just follow the guidelines and ask for help from him and you'll be okay. Exams were kind of tough, but only a few questions each, so look at the practice exams.

Tests you over rote memorization of schematics. Schematics are very detailed. You talk about a horrible approach to teaching. Why does it matter if I can remember the exact location of a capacitor if I can tell you exactly how the circuit functions. Essentially, he is the teacher that dissuades you from becoming a teacher. Nice guy though.

Posts all annotated lectures on Carmen.  Very clear and easy to understand lectures. Very kind and willing to help students. Goes over homework problems in class. He will curve. He definitely prepares you for exams. Posts practice tests. Fair grader. Will provide 1 sheet of notes for you for tests. I would absolutely take a class with him again.
you should  see that clear in  the class
Very helpful but gives pop quizzes with no warning that can be very confusing. Exams are too long for allotted time. Does not provide examples of exam questions. Very frustrating.
Not sure what to say. He is a nice person but does not know how to teach well.
He is a very kind professor and always willing to help students. His teaching is clear, also
One of the best professors I ever had. Class material is tough, but he is very helpful if you go to his office and chat with him. I can't think of a reason not to go to his class.

This professor is more interested in recruiting students for his software startup than actual teaching.
I would never take a class from him again.
His attempts at humor fall flat.
He loves the movie office space and quotes from it frequently, which I viewed as immature and childish.
Huge waste of my hard-earned scholarship funds.

Terrible English.
He wasted the entirety of the first class session to establish detailed rules on how students should ask questions.
Poor teaching, using formulas and equations for instruction of computer programming.
Absolutely regret ever taking his course.

He knows the material very well, yet gives priority to his research and seems not interested in teaching. Not available outside of class and cancelled a couple for travelling. Does not come to midterms or final and puts far more questions than can be solved in the exam time. The questions are very easy but no time is even given to think.
Fantastic choice of content and great instructor. Teaches the relevant stuff.

Prof, Koksal is a great guy, his class is thought stimulating and we learnt SO much from him, very inspiring homework and always helpful during the office hour, I would DEFINITELY suggest everyone to take this class, and this class goes well with 5200, so make sure you take them at the same time to have a better understanding for both ;)
Built fundamental understanding on a complex topic. Knows the concepts extremely well and puts them into a very natural and accessible form. Excellent teaching.

I do regret that I have taken his course. I wish I have taken a statistics course instead. Poor English, poor teaching. The class becomes real torment. I wish I have taken some other course instead of taking ECE 6001.
I do regret taking the course. poor English, poor teaching... what a torment!
He is an amazing professor. He knows the concepts deeply and explains clairly.Also, he is very helpful at the office hours.

His exams were not very hard but they were not easy, same style as review sheet but not very similar, but you have to be very good at the topics that the sample midterm have.The book was almost useless.He didn't give a sample midterm for the final and it was hard.Could give an extra 5% for participation but other than that he doesn't curve.
Very clear in lectures, reasonable exams. Always willing to answer questions after class.
knws the stuff, but spans too many topics. Could esaily get lost in class.
Professor Lee Potter is the Game 7 LeBron of the ece department. Let this guy teach everything he's the goat.
Dr. Potter is easily one of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. Very responsive to emails, no surprises on the test. I wish he could teach all my classes!
Best professor at OSU. Be sure to read lots of stuffs and come to lectures fully prepared so you dont miss anything
Amazing professor, but his homework assignments can be tough to finish so make sure to start early on those. Super helpful professor especially during office hours and has very fair exams/quizzes.

3050 was a really difficult class for me, but Seriously one of the best professors at OSU. Extremely caring and puts people first. Be ready to study a lot as 3050 itself is a difficult class, but taking it with Lee potter is the way to go.

Professor Lee's class was very hard, but he also was extremely accessible. Had office hours almost every day, and would literally help you go through the homework problem if you are stuck. He wants you to learn and to be challenged, but he's willing to help you throughout the way. Take advantage of the extra credit project. Would def. take again!

Lee Potter is quite possibly the best professor at Ohio State. I'm going into my 4th year at OSU and haven't had anyone who even compares. His classes are challenging, but his help sessions are very good and he will work with you on homework problems you are stuck on. Take his classes whenever you can. You won't regret it.

Greatest professor Ive had in the three years I have been here; truly cares about students and wants to see them succeed. Put the effort in for a 3000 level class and you will do well. See you in ECE5200!

LECTURES: Great; Material easy to understand and intriguing lectures; Attend and pay attention; Fill in lecture notes provided. HOMEWORKS: Weekly HW; Weekly Q&A sessions were very helpful; HW can sometimes be long but is worth doing to understand the material and do well on the exams. EXAMS: Easier versions of HW problems; previous samples provided
Great lecturer

By far the best ECE professor I've had. Actually wants to teach and does all he can to help the students. Definitely go to his homework review because it helps a ton. His test are very fair. He prints notes every class and his lectures make the material much easier to understand than 2050.

By far the best professor i've had at Ohio State. Great lectures, scans his notes and posts them online. Has hw help sessions multiple times a week. Exams are fair. Just a pleasant experience having a class with him. He'll always have my respect.

This man is a twin brother of Jon Bon Jovi: looks like a punk-type guys born in the 60s, inspirational, great social awareness, and successful in their own field. You don't want to miss any of his lectures because all are fantastic! I think I may give him a big hug after this class ends, and I want to be the little version of him in the future!

I love this guy to bits! Caring, dedicated, passionate, generous, and a great model for people to learn from and grow up! The materials, homework set, and exams are all difficult, but you will learn a lot since he will enforce you how to think as an engineer and how his teachings can be applied to the real-world problems.  I wish Lee was my father!

A great teacher. Really caring. Really wants to make everything interesting and he always manages to. Great choice if you guys who want to learn something and get good grades (but you have to work hard in the first place).

Best Electrical Engineering Professor at OSU had him for 3050,5000, and 5200. Had him for 3 semesters and goes out of his way to help any student. Learned a lot from him and would take any class he teaches. Also posts all of his slides online.
Greatest professor at Osu ECE had him for 3050 as well goes above and beyond every time. Has hw help sessions two times a week and is always helpful. Tough but fair grader.

Prof Potter is the one of the best instructors at OSU!  He will go out of his way to make sure you do well and understand the material.   Study his notes & don't start homework the night before and you'll be okay.  If you actually understand the material you'll do really well.

Professor Potter is seriously the best professor I have ever had.  I have never had a professor able to explain hard concepts in a way that anyone can understand. If you don't understand anything, go to his numerous help sessions or office hours and he will bend over backwards to help you understand. He is a dying breed of professors who care.

Potter is awesome. I wish I can take another course with him before I graduate. The material is tough, but he simplifies it for you. Homework is hard but he helps you do it (almost does it for you in the help session). The exams are hard but it's things you learned in class. I recommend Lee for ECE 5200.

I took the online portion of this class. It's really just a screen recording of her live in-person class that happens during the same time. Any time she walks away from the mic at all you won't be able to understand her. The cost of tuition keeps going up but they want to use xbox 360 mics to record lectures for an online only class.

Irem is really great in Cybersecurity as she doesn't make the class overly difficult. However, the negative reviews for 2560 are understandable as that class was really difficult and she was much harsher in terms of grading. But she is actually a lot more understanding if you see her in person but not so much over email
AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS! She doesn't care about the students or doesn't bother about them at all not at all considerate about anything
She doesnt have a heart. Dont take her, doesnt accomodate circumstances
Lectures are clear and Informative. The course contains weekly tests, which shouldn't be tough if someone attends class regularly. Good Grades.

Pretty much taught myself the class. No textbook. There are user manuals, but they are difficult to understand. Lectures are not amazing. Don't go into enough detail. Office hours are good from what I hear, but if you have class during that time, good luck. Does answer emails quickly, but often tells you to review previous lectures.
Office hours are very helpful. The lectures were boring but that is not entirely on her. She gave you tools for success. Theory questions were awfully specific though.

I honestly don't understand the negative reviews. She made the class very straightforward and put a lot of effort  into making her lectures engaging and informative. She also cares immensely for her students and their success, which will be evident if you take a class with her. She definitely deserves a higher rating.
Her instruction made the class pretty straightforward. There was also (optional) harder problems if you wanted them. If she's hard for you maybe change majors

For everyone giving her bad ratings, I don't know what kind of drugs you're on. I had her for both 5561 AND 2560. Best programming/intro course experiences ever! For 2560, what helped the most was office hours. For 5561, the class was online, NO CODING necessary. She's the best. You guys are just slow. If she's bad to you, you are delusional.

This was Professor Eryilmaz's first time teaching, so there is a lot she was still working out. She was trying to make 2560 more rigorous than it has been in the past. That said, I appreciate the changes she was trying to make. She was amazing at responding to your emails in great detail and truly cared about your understanding of topics.

I wanted to write this review because I believe this teacher deserves a higher score than she currently has. I felt that she did a very good job at teaching ECE 2560, and she was always willing to give feedback. She is exceptionally helpful during office hours and she responds to emails very fast. She is good teacher who cares about her students

It was her first time teaching this class and it was a bit of a mess. The class was not awful but not easy by any means. I only went to around 8 lectures all year and will be ending with an A+. She answers emails and questions on assignments quickly and is very willing to help.

Lectures were a bit hard to follow and did not go deep enough. Assignments include quizzes and tricky activities. The midterm was poorly scheduled and hard. The assignment that determines your grade is a research paper, which is fairly easy with a good group. This is the first time this class was offered, it was okay, but I wanted more out of it.
The worst professor I ever had in my life. Avoid her with all means. She really enjoys giving the students hard time. The university should get another professor

One of the worst of professors I ever had in my life. She gets students confused all the time. We had a midterm at the end of the class that she mad it so long and hard, and the average grade was D. She really wanted to fail students and give them hard time. If someone from the department is reading please get another professor.

Literally the worst professor I've ever had. Everything she grades is based on her opinion of what is right, not what she teaches. All the quizzes are open book but her questions are so unclear you have no idea what she's actually asking. She doesn't give good feedback and won't explain why you got questions wrong. Brought my grade down, avoid her.

Tawfiq is a fantastic professor who is very passionate, engaging, and intelligent. Can come across as intimidating but truly just wants you to learn and apply yourself. He is very caring and willing to help. His wit and charisma made his lectures the best part of my semester.

One of the best professors here. Very knowledgeable, charismatic, and passionate. Cares about learning and is very willing to help outside of class as long as you apply yourself and make an effort to understand the material.
One of the best professors in this univ.

Great guy who helped me really understand the material. He tries to scare people into taking the class seriously. Study for the quizzes and don't be afraid to ask questions. The final was more difficult than the midterms by a bit even though I did well. Only complaint would be homework questions were sometimes unclear or needed things not taught.

Amazing professor. Definitely knows what he's talking about. He'll make sure you are confident in circuit analysis by the end of the semester. He's also hilarious. Enjoyed going to every one of his lectures because he made it very entertaining.

Amazing guy. I loved my time learning about life and electronics with Dr. Musah. This guy starts with the hard task of undoing bad habits from 2020 and does it and by the end, the mystery of electronics feels lifted. If I wasn't already an EE major at this point, I would switch here.

Dr. Musah was a great lecturer! I loved the fact that he's different from other professors and that he forces you to actually learn the material rather than remembering formulas. He grades test very generously and is just a funny guy overall!

Passionate and cared about students' learning. This meant he did not hand out answers to questions; he wanted students to really think and work it out for themselves. So, to succeed you need to be willing to put in more effort than other professors ask. Exams and project were difficult, but doable if you know lecture material inside and out.

Professor Musah is wonderful. He may come across as slightly harsh but he is never mean or belittling and simply wants you to try hard and to succeed. Will cover questions during office hours or class. Be prepared to be called on to answer in class. Tests are very reasonable (one page of notes), graded fairly. Overall would highly recommend him.

Phenomenal professor. Dedicated to students learning the material, and incredibly helpful in office hours. The class is a lot of work, but circuits are complex and require that. He makes sure you get practice with Virtuoso with HWs, and makes very helpful tutorials. I left the class with a good conceptual understanding of fundamental digital ICs.

Only take this class if you are really passionate about electronics. He makes everyone feel stupid for asking questions and will change directions on the day that projects are due. Wish I couldve dropped the class. Were in a pandemic and he made it even harder.

Best Professor I have ever met in OSU. He cares about his students and can tell everyone's name after the first week. He teaches more than circuits but how to solve problems in the lecture. It is not easy to get an A because he uses distribution to grade, but the grade fair. If you want to learn something useful, he is the best option.
Extremely passionate about students learning the material well. He goes above and beyond to make sure you understand concepts rather than just memorizing solutions.

Tawfiq is one of the best professors I've had at my time at OSU. He gets to know each of his students quickly, checks on them periodically, and volunteers lots of time outside of class for chances to get help. In addition, his lectures are great and his advice from his time in industry is very helpful and insightful. OSU is very lucky to have him.

This professor was clueless. We had a project that was straight from a textbook and she couldnt even bother to read the project description before assigning it so she couldnt answer any of our questions. She also would lead discussions in class and anytime someone would disagree with her radical beliefs she would send out false statistics on carmen

This professor is more interested in recruiting students for his software startup than actual teaching.

Potter is awesome. I wish I can take another course with him before I graduate. The material is tough, but he simplifies it for you. Homework is hard but he helps you do it (almost does it for you in the help session). The exams are hard but it's things you learned in class. I recommend Lee for ECE 5200.

Professor Potter is extremely helpful. He has homework review sessions each week and sometimes has "blue slip" quizzes that aren't graded to gauge the class's understanding. Potter is excellent at simplifying complex material and his exams are fair. I learned so much from Potter, and I think that everyone should take a class with him if possible.
Professor Potter goes above and beyond. I scheduled another class that I did not need just to get his teaching again and learn from an experienced man in the field of engineering. 7 stars / 5

The best professor that ive had at OSU. He also has a degree in mathematics so his lectures are amazing with quality math proofs in them. The homeworks are hard but he helps you do them in the review sessions and also has a review session before the exams. Exams are composed of easy homework problems. Gives a curve if need and cares about students

Very clear with lectures. Makes the material easy and is extremely helpful outside of class. Don't be fooled by how easy the material seems in class and on hw, know the material well for the exams. Overall I would recommend him for any class.

Lee Potter is a dedicated professor. Prof. Potter goes beyond out of his way to make sure anyone in need of help has plenty of resources. Potter is very organized and this helps when it comes to completing homework assignments or reviewing for exams. Lectures are all that is needed to completely understand the material.

I had him for 301 and again for 352.  His HW and tests could have some challenging parts but were always very fair.  All calculations were straightforward, he was more concerned with concepts.  He is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  He is simply awesome at teaching.
His exams are very hard.Also his grading is tough.His practice exams are not similar to the actual exam so don't depend on the practice exams.You have to study a lot just to pass.
Very helpful, makes the class easy and fun. HW and tests are easy and fair. I'd recommend him.
awesome.
He is a perfect teacher and a great motivator and also a cool advisor.

One of the best proffessors at osu.  Helpful, fair, understanding, organized, etc. If you can take 501 and 508 with him then take it!  It was refreshing to have a professor who genuinely wanted to teach and it showed.
Potter is awesome. Best prof I've had at OSU. Totally down to earth, easy to understand, approachable, helpful. Take him for 501 and/or 600 if you can.
No Comments
Nice and willing to help students. Good professor to have for senior project design. I highly recommend this professor.
Awesome professor, awesome class.  Gives out notes in advance, you fill in your own stuff.  Tough but totally fair tests.  You will really learn a lot from Potter, trust me.
Very good teacher, very helpful. Reasonable grading
Take EE600 with him! Very good class, very good lectures. Decent curve at the end.

Great professor.  Kind, helpful, and cares a lot about his students.  Passes out packets to take notes on and never runs out of interesting facts and stories about the material.  His assignments can be long and his tests aren't easy, but they reflect the course content very well.
Good teacher, always willing to help you out.  Has more knowledge than time to teach it all.  Sometimes gives you a little more info than you really need but you can tell he's really into teaching.
Drew did a good job teaching the course. It was difficult but he kept lectures interesting and made class enjoyable.
Midterms are awful, homework's are long and grueling

I don't know what's wrong with people. I saw comments saying it's easy.  I go to his office hours too. And you want to talk about trying hard? I finished the homework the day after he posted it, read the textbook, reviewed all the lectures, and did extra questions from the book and I'm still doomed. Am I trying hard enough?

Actions speak louder than words man. I'm not speaking for anyone else, just myself, I've spent so much time and effort on this course, and I still did terribly. That's why I've kind of lost my faith in him. I don't think he's a bad person at all. I care and I've gone above and beyond, but maybe I'm just still not good enough for this class.
I think he is a good person, but those inperson midterms are just inhuman.
Crashing out

The midterm was hard, and I probably didn't pass, but getting a bad grade doesn't give you a free pass to insult someone. We're adults; we don't throw rants and fits when life happens. Professor Phillips is a great person who cares about his students, but he overestimated our skills. He's new, but I'm confident he'll become a great professor.

DON'T TAKE 2060 w him. I don't have a single good thing to say about this guy. His lectures could be 10 minutes but he requires attendance for a 500+ person class. His slides are so simple and the concepts are so easy and he chooses to make the homework and midterms 100x more in depth. He doesn't grade/respond to emails. His voice is is annoying.

I took this class thinking it would be an easier class reading from previous reviews. However, I got hit in the face with hours of homework and nearly impossible to do midterms in 30 minutes. I can't even begin to imagine how the final will look like. Drew is a great guy, but his lectures are useless and the class structure is terrible.
Very unprofessional and clueless professor based on my experience so far!

I really tried to like this dude, seems like a good guy overall. But he has ZERO concept of time he gives midterms that are overall fair questions in regard to the content, but comprehending his subpar instructions takes half of the allotted 30 minutes on the written portion. And on the online portions of his exams time restrictions are even worse.

Professor Drew is very passionate about his lectures. He clearly spends a lot of time preparing for the course slides and the notes on it. He might expect all students to have the same passion as he does so he takes attendance for a 500 person class and overestimated students' ability on midterm 2. I'm sure he will accommodate for that midterm.

Yes, I failed the midterm. No, it's not that deep. Seriously. Homework is reasonable if you start early and his lectures are mildly helpful. Besides the in-class part of the second midterm he's a 4 star professor. If he curves it I will change this to a 4.

In halls of steel and static grey,
Where whispers hum, where shadows sway,
